results.title: Bogota: fragments of a city
results.creator_credit: Jan-henk Kleijn, Manuel Rivos and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A young photographer walks through the streets of Colombia’s capital, capturing images of life in what he characterises as a sad and old city. His expressive sepia coloured stills of people and his personal impressions and reactions heard in voice-over form the focus of this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan-henk Kleijn, Manuel Rivos and International Film Foundation

results.title: Bodywork
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: Confessions from the funeral trade. There are no cadavers in Bodywork, because the film is about the living. David Caesar introduces us to the workers of the death industry rather than the clients. What they talk about is fascinating; how they say it is riveting. The various stages of mortuary work are explained by people who take pride in their profession. “Bodywork” is a thoroughly illuminating and entertaining film. This film won the Best Documentary Award at the 1989 Melbourne Film Festival.

results.title: Bodyspeak
results.creator_credit: Gregor Nicholas and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: Bodyspeak juxtaposes elaborate dances from different cultures, each carrying its ritual significance in the highly disciplined gestures and movements of the performers. Notions of sexual/cultural difference and prejudice are examined through techniques of cultural collision and juxtaposition. No commentary - music only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gregor Nicholas and New Zealand Film Commission

results.brief_description: Explores the world of nonverbal communication using arms, feet, fingers, hands, and head. Includes spoken introduction and some mime. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Body defenses against the outside world
results.brief_description: Describes dangers in the environment and the body’s principal defenses against them; the skin, mucous membrane, bone structure, the five senses and the autonomic nervous system. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Body defenses against disease. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines the three lines of defence against infection - the skin and mucous membrane, the lymphatic system and the circulatory system including liver and spleen. Explains how the body becomes immune to certain diseases, and how to improve defences against infection.

results.title: Body care and grooming
results.brief_description: Made in 1947 to promote good grooming techniques for males and females. Shows boys and girls of senior high school taking care of their skin, hair, nails and teeth thus demonstrating habits which should form part of every ‘civilised’ person’s daily routine. Although the film has dated, it captures the styles and attitudes of the time.

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.
